# $\first{Figure Types}$

```{r echo=FALSE}
data <- gapminder %>% filter(year == 2007)
```

***

### $\second{Scatter}$

#### $\third{- Basic Plot}$ 
  
Required: `x`, `y` 

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x=gdpPercap, y=lifeExp)) + 
  geom_point()
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Aesthetics}$ 
  
Optional: `aplpha`, `color`, `fill`, `shape`, `size`

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x=gdpPercap, y=lifeExp, fill=continent, size=pop)) + 
  geom_point(color="black", alpha=0.7, shape=25) 
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Jittering}$

`geom_point(position="jitter")`

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x=continent, y=lifeExp)) + 
  geom_point()
```

<br>

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x=continent, y=lifeExp)) + 
  geom_point(position="jitter")
```

<br>

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x=continent, y=lifeExp)) + 
  geom_point(position=position_jitter(width=0.1))
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Trend Lines}$ 

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x=gdpPercap, y=lifeExp)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  scale_x_log10() +
  geom_smooth(method="lm")
```

<br>

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x=gdpPercap, y=lifeExp, color=continent)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  scale_x_log10() +
  geom_smooth(method="lm", se=FALSE) +
  geom_smooth(method="lm", se=FALSE, aes(group=1, color="Overall Global"), linetype=2) +
  scale_color_manual("Region", values= c("firebrick3","orange","#1B9E77","royalblue3","mediumpurple4","black"))
```

***

### $\second{Histogram}$

*Shows the binned distribution of a _continuous_ variable*  

<br>

#### $\third{- Basic Plot}$ 
  
Required: `x`

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x = lifeExp)) +
  geom_histogram()
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Aesthetics}$

*See the section on aesthetics for bar graphs, below*

<br>

#### $\third{- Custom Bins}$ 
  
Optional: `bins` or `binwidth`

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x = lifeExp)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 3)
```

<br>

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x = lifeExp)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 10)
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Frequency}$ 

Optional: `y` (which makes it frequency instead of count)

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x = lifeExp, y = ..density..)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 10)
```

***

### $\second{Bar}$

#### $\third{- Absolute Count Bar}$ 

*Shows the distribution of a _discrete_ variable*

Required: `x`

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x = continent)) + 
  geom_bar()
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Distribution Bar}$

*Shows a selected statistic for each category of the variable selected*

Required: `x`, `y`

```{r}
data %>%
  group_by(continent) %>%
  summarize(mean_life = mean(lifeExp)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = continent, y = mean_life)) + 
  geom_col()
```

<br>

```{r}
data %>%
  group_by(continent) %>%
  summarize(mean_life = mean(lifeExp), 
            sd_life = sd(lifeExp)
            ) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = continent, y = mean_life)) + 
  geom_col(fill ="grey50") + 
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=(mean_life - sd_life), 
                    ymax=(mean_life + sd_life), 
                    width=0.2
                    )
                )
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Stacked Bar}$

```{r}
gapminder %>%
  group_by(year, continent) %>%
  summarize(tot_pop = sum(as.numeric(pop))) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = tot_pop, fill = continent)) +
  geom_col()
```

<br> 

#### $\third{- Proportional Fill}$

```{r}
gapminder %>%
  group_by(year, continent) %>%
  summarize(tot_pop = sum(as.numeric(pop))) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=year, y=tot_pop, fill=continent)) +
  geom_col(position="fill")
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Separate Groups}$

```{r}
gapminder %>%
  group_by(year, continent) %>%
  summarize(tot_pop = sum(as.numeric(pop))) %>% 
  filter(year %in% c(1957, 1977, 1997)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = continent, y = tot_pop, fill = factor(year))) +
  geom_col(position = "dodge")
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Aesthetics}$

Optional: `aplpha`, `color`, `fill`

```{r}
data %>%
  group_by(continent) %>%
  summarize(mean_life = mean(lifeExp)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = continent, y = mean_life)) + 
  geom_col(color = "darkblue", fill = "lightblue")
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Reorder Bars}$

```{r}
data %>%
  group_by(continent) %>%
  summarize(mean_life = mean(lifeExp), 
            sd_life = sd(lifeExp)
            ) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(continent, mean_life), y = mean_life)) + 
  geom_col()
```

<br>

```{r}
data %>%
  group_by(continent) %>%
  summarize(mean_life = mean(lifeExp), 
            sd_life = sd(lifeExp)
            ) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(continent, -mean_life), y = mean_life)) + 
  geom_col()
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Reorder Stack}$

```{r}
gapminder %>%
  group_by(year, continent) %>%
  summarize(tot_pop = sum(as.numeric(pop))) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = tot_pop, fill = continent)) +
  geom_col(position = position_stack(reverse = TRUE)) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(reverse = TRUE))
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Bar Size/Spacing}$

```{r}
data %>%
  group_by(continent) %>%
  summarize(mean_life = mean(lifeExp), 
            sd_life = sd(lifeExp)
            ) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = continent, y = mean_life)) + 
  geom_col(width = 0.5)
```

<br> 

```{r}
data %>%
  group_by(continent) %>%
  summarize(mean_life = mean(lifeExp), 
            sd_life = sd(lifeExp)
            ) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = continent, y = mean_life)) +  
  geom_col(width = 1)
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Labels}$

```{r}
data %>%
  group_by(continent) %>%
  summarize(mean_life = mean(lifeExp), 
            sd_life = sd(lifeExp)
            ) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=continent, y=mean_life)) + 
  geom_col() +
  geom_text(aes(label = round(mean_life, 2)), vjust = 1.5, color = "white")
```

***

### $\second{Line}$

#### $\third{- Basic Plot}$ 

Required: `x`, `y`

```{r}
gapminder %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  summarize(pop = sum(as.numeric(pop))) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=year, y=pop)) + 
  geom_line()
```

<br>

```{r}
gapminder %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  summarize(pop = sum(as.numeric(pop))) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=year, y=pop)) + 
  geom_line() +
  geom_point()
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Aesthetics}$

Optional: `color`, `size`, `alpha`, `linetype`

```{r}
gapminder %>%
  group_by(year, continent) %>%
  summarize(pop = sum(as.numeric(pop))) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = pop, color = continent)) +
  geom_line(size = 1, alpha = 0.6)
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Area Plot}$

```{r}
gapminder %>%
  group_by(year, continent) %>%
  summarize(pop = sum(as.numeric(pop))) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=year, y=pop, fill=continent)) +
  geom_area()
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Proportion Plot}$

```{r}
gapminder %>%
  group_by(year, continent) %>%
  summarize(pop = sum(as.numeric(pop))) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=year, y=pop, fill=continent)) +
  geom_area(position="fill")
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Recession Example}$

```{r}
recessions <- tibble(
  begin = c("1969-12-01", "1973-11-01", "1980-01-01", 
            "1981-07-01", "1990-07-01", "2001-03-01"
            ),
    end = c("1970-11-01", "1975-03-01", "1980-07-01", 
            "1982-11-01", "1991-03-01", "2001-11-01")
  ) %>%
  mutate(begin = as.Date(begin),
         end = as.Date(end)
         )

ggplot(economics, aes(x = date, y = unemploy/pop)) +
  geom_rect(data = recessions, inherit.aes = FALSE,
            aes(xmin = begin, xmax = end, ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf),
            fill = "red", alpha = 0.2) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(
    x = "",
    y = "Unemployment Rate",
    title = "Relationship Between Recessions and Unemployment"
  )
```

### $\second{Cleveland Dot}$

```{r}
gapminder %>%
  filter(continent == "Asia", year == 2007) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = lifeExp, y = reorder(country, lifeExp))) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(
    panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.major.y = element_line(colour = "grey60", linetype = "dashed")
  )

```

### $\second{Functions}$

```{r}
my_fun <- function(xvar) {
  1 / (1 + exp(-xvar + 10))
}

ggplot(data.frame(x = c(0, 20)), aes(x = x)) +
  stat_function(fun = my_fun, geom = "line")
```

sample <- tibble(

# $\first{Labels}$

***

### $\second{Adding}$

```{r}
figure + 
  labs(
    title = "This is my title",
    subtitle = "This is my subtitle",
    x = "This is my x-axis",
    y = "This is my y-axis",
    fill = "This is my fill legend",
    color = "This is my color legend",
    caption = "This is my caption"
    )
```

***

### $\second{Formatting}$

```{r echo=FALSE}
figure <- figure + 
  labs(
    title = "This is my title",
    subtitle = "This is my subtitle",
    x = "This is my x-axis",
    y = "This is my y-axis",
    fill = "This is my fill legend",
    color = "This is my color legend",
    caption = "This is my caption"
    )
```

`element_text()`

* `color = `
* `size = `
* `face = "plain"/"italic"/"bold"/"bold.italic"`
* `family = `
* `hjust = ` 
* `vjust = `


```{r}
figure + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold.italic"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(color = "darkgray"),
    plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0),
    axis.title.x = element_text(hjust = 1)
  )
```

# $\first{Axes}$

***

The `scale_` functions include whether the axis is `_x_` or `_y_` and whether the variable plotted is `_discrete()` or `_continuous()`:

* `scale_x_discrete()`
* `scale_y_continuous()`

```{r echo=FALSE}
gapminder_figure <- filter(gapminder, year == 2007) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=gdpPercap, y=lifeExp)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  labs(
    x = "GDP Per Capita",
    y = "Life Expectancy"
  )

gapminder_figure
```

<br>

### $\second{Limiting}$

*Caution, this will drop data outside of the limits (including bars)* 

```{r}
gapminder_figure + 
  scale_y_continuous(limit = c(30,100))
```

***

### $\second{Setting Breaks}$

*Caution, this will still plot points outside of the range of the breaks leaving the rest of the y axis blank*

```{r}
gapminder_figure + 
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(40, 60, 80))
```

<br>

```{r}
gapminder_figure + 
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(40, 60, 80),
                     labels = c("Low", "Medium", "High")) 
```

<br>

`scales` formats: 

* `comma`
* `percent`
* `scientific`

```{r}
gapminder_figure + 
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma)
```

***

### $\second{Scaling}$

```{r}
gapminder_figure + 
  scale_x_continuous(trans = "log10")
```

# $\first{Visuals}$

***

### $\second{Aesthetics}$

|Aesthetic|Description|Values|
|---------|-----------|------|
|x        |x-axis data|      |
|y        |y-axis data|      |
|color    |color of dots, outline of other shapes|![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/social-lorax/howto_codebooks/master/images/ggplot_colors.png)|
|fill     |fill color|Same as color|
|alpha    |transparency|![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/social-lorax/howto_codebooks/master/images/ggplot_alpha.png)|
|size     |diameter of points, thickness of lines|![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/social-lorax/howto_codebooks/master/images/ggplot_thickness.png)|
|linetype |line dash pattern|![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/social-lorax/howto_codebooks/master/images/ggplot_lines.png)|
|labels   |text on a plot or axes|see below|
|shape    |shape of dot|![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/social-lorax/howto_codebooks/master/images/ggplot_shapes.png)|  

<br> 

#### $\third{- Setting Colors}$

*Brewer* 

`scale_color_brewer(palette = "Spectral")`  
`scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Spectral")`

<center>

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/social-lorax/howto_codebooks/master/images/ggplot_palete1.png)
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/social-lorax/howto_codebooks/master/images/ggplot_palete2.png)
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/social-lorax/howto_codebooks/master/images/ggplot_palete3.png)

</center> 


```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x = gdpPercap, y = lifeExp, color = continent)) + 
  geom_point() +
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Spectral") ###
```

*Manual* 

`scale_color_manual(values = c("color", "color", "color"))`  
`scale_fill_manual(values = c("color", "color", "color"))`

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x = gdpPercap, y = lifeExp, color = continent)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  scale_color_manual(values = c("deeppink",       
                                "deepskyblue4",   
                                "seagreen4",      
                                "darkorchid1",    
                                "coral3"
                                )         
                     )                             
```

# $\first{Annotation}$

***

### $\second{Text}$

```{r}
gapminder_figure + 
  annotate("text", 
           x = 14000, 
           y = 57, 
           label = "This Country",
           vjust = 0,
           hjust = 0,
           color = "darkgreen",
           size = 3,
           fontface = "bold.italic")
```

***

### $\second{Lines}$

```{r}
gapminder_figure + 
  geom_hline(yintercept = 60,
             color = "blue",
             linetype = 2) + 
  geom_vline(xintercept = 25000,
             color = "purple",
             linetype = 1)
```

***

### $\second{Segments}$

```{r}
gapminder_figure + 
  annotate("segment",
           x = 10000,
           xend = 15000,
           y = 47,
           yend = 56)
```

***

### $\second{Shapes}$

```{r}
gapminder_figure + 
  annotate("rect",
           xmin = 9000,
           xmax = 15000,
           ymin = 47,
           ymax = 58,
           alpha = 0.3)
```

# $\first{Patchwork}$

***

### $\second{Installation}$

```{r}
# install.packages("devtools")
# devtools::install_github("thomasp85/patchwork")

library(tidyverse)
library(patchwork)
```

```{r echo=FALSE}
p1 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_point(aes(mpg, disp))
p2 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_boxplot(aes(gear, disp, group = gear))
p3 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_smooth(aes(disp, qsec))
p4 <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_bar(aes(carb))
```

### $\second{Layout}$

#### $\third{- Basic}$ 

```{r}
p1 + p2
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Setting Columns and Rows}$ 

```{r}
p1 + p2 + p3 + plot_layout(ncol = 1)
```

<br>

```{r}
p1 + p2 + p3 + plot_layout(nrow = 1)
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Advanced Layouts}$ 

```{r}
(p1 | p2 | p3) /
      p4
```

<br>

```{r}
p1 + (p2 + p3) + p4 + plot_layout(ncol = 1)
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Nesting}$ 

```{r}
p4 + 
  {p1 + 
      {p2 + p3 + plot_layout(ncol = 1)}
  } + 
  plot_layout(ncol = 1)
```

***

### $\second{Visual Settings}$

#### $\third{- Setting Sizes}$ 

`heights(row1, row2, . . .)`  
`widths(col1, col2, . . .)`

```{r}
p1 + p2 + p3 + p4 + plot_layout(nrow = 2, heights = c(1,2), widths = c(2,1))
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Adding Blank Space Between}$ 

```{r}
p1 + plot_spacer() + p2
```

<br>

### $\second{Annotating}$

#### $\third{- Basic Titles}$ 

```{r}
p1 + p2 + plot_annotation(title = "A great plot!", tag_levels = "A")
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Better Subtitles}$ 

```{r}
p1 + labs(subtitle = "A. This is Plot 1") +
  p2 + labs(subtitle = "B. This is Plot 2") + 
  plot_annotation(title = "A great plot!")
```

<br>

#### $\third{- Formatting}$ 

```{r}
p1 + p2 + 
  plot_annotation(
    title = "Here is a Complexly Formatted, Simple Graph",
    caption = str_glue("Sources: ggplot\n\nNote: This is just basic analysis as an example."),
    theme = theme(
      plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", hjust = 1),
      plot.caption = element_text(face = "italic", hjust = 0)
      )
    )
```
